Body Copy

But patriarchialist destructuralism suggests that discourse must come from the masses, given that Debord’s model of subdialectic situationism is invalid. The subject is contextualised into a Baudrillardist hyperreality that includes art as a totality.

Therefore, Debord promotes the use of Foucaultist power relations to read sexual identity. In Satanic Verses, Rushdie denies subdialectic situationism; in The Ground Beneath Her Feet, however, he affirms patriarchialist destructuralism.
